exit.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a door or space through which you can leave a public room, building etc
emergency/fire exit (=a special door used only when there is a fire etc)
exit.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: We made for the nearest exit.
Two men were blocking her exit.
exit.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: when you leave a room or building
exit.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: They made a quick exit when they saw the police approaching.
exit.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a place where vehicles can leave a road such as a motorway, and join another road
exit.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Take the next exit for Lynchburg.
exit.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: when someone stops being involved in a competition or business, especially because they have not been successful
exit.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: France’s early exit from the World Cup

exit.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: And then, kissing them both goodbye, he made his exit.

exit.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a British organization which aims to change the law against helping seriously ill people to die if they wish to. The organization gives advice to such people and their families. The Hemlock Society is a similar organization in the US.
